notes: Second generation compact SUV (1998-2005). V6 engine introduced 2001. Rebadged as Chevy Tracker. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki Vitara article, January 2025 revision.
Compact sedan/wagon final years (1995-2002). Replaced by Aerio. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki Esteem article, January 2025 revision.
Compact sedan/wagon (2001-2007). Replaced Esteem. AWD available. Discontinued 2007. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki Aerio article, January 2025 revision.
Rebadged Daewoo Lacetti (2004-2008). Built by GM Daewoo in Korea. Budget sedan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki Forenza article, January 2025 revision.
Rebadged Daewoo Lacetti hatchback (2004-2008). Built by GM Daewoo in Korea. Forenza hatchback variant. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki Reno article, January 2025 revision.
Second generation compact SUV (2005-2015). Larger than previous Vitara. 3.2L V6 introduced 2009. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki Grand Vitara article, January 2025 revision.
Rebadged Chevy Equinox/Pontiac Torrent on GM Theta platform (2006-2009). Built in Canada. Three-row seating. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki XL7 article, January 2025 revision.
Rebadged Daewoo Magnus (2004-2006). Built by GM Daewoo in Korea. Inline-6 engine. Poor sales. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki Verona article, January 2025 revision.
